hf.name: Marcus
hf.clothing: Dark jeans and a leather jacket

tr.name: Olivia
tr.appearance: Gray hair in a messy bun, colorful scarf
tr.clothing: Bohemian style dress and multiple rings

json_to_edit.voice_over: Little did they know, the typewriter held secrets of both past and future.
json_to_edit.description: A group investigates a haunted typewriter that mysteriously predicts future events.
json_to_edit.location: Dusty attic of an old Victorian house
json_to_edit.lighting: Dim, with shafts of moonlight through a small window
json_to_edit.name: The Prophetic Typewriter
json_to_edit.scene_summary: Emily, Marcus, and Olivia investigate a haunted typewriter that writes future events, while the ghost of Theodore observes.

qa.action: Emily, Marcus, and Olivia enter the attic, their flashlights revealing dusty furniture and the typewriter on an old desk.

hf.action: The typewriter's keys move on their own, typing out a message.

tr.action: Emily and Marcus lean in to read the typed message, their expressions a mix of shock and disbelief.

xc.action: From Olivia's perspective, we see the typed message predicting tomorrow's headline.

ka.action: The camera pans across the room, revealing the ghost of Theodore watching the group with amusement.

fn.action: Marcus attempts to touch the typewriter but pulls back as if shocked, his skepticism visibly shaken.

af.action: The typewriter's mechanisms move in impossible ways, defying physics as it types another message.

edit_command: Remove every second shot from the scene, but don't change anything else.

updated_json.voice_over: Little did they know, the typewriter held secrets of both past and future.
updated_json.description: A group investigates a haunted typewriter that mysteriously predicts future events.
updated_json.location: Dusty attic of an old Victorian house
updated_json.lighting: Dim, with shafts of moonlight through a small window
updated_json.name: The Prophetic Typewriter

tr.action: Emily and Marcus lean in to read the typed message, their expressions a mix of shock and disbelief.

label.rationale: we will remove every second shot from the scene as requested, while keeping all other elements of the json unchanged. this means we'll remove shots with keys "hf", "xc", and "fn", leaving shots "qa", "tr", "ka", and "af". we'll update the "list_display_order" accordingly and adjust the "number_of_shots" from "7" to "4". all other information in the json will remain the same.
